monogr.title: A Digital Dictionary of Shawi Arabic

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the SHAWI teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the SHAWI network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.
Private URIs using the dict prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a entry in the SHAWI glossary.
Private URIs using the rend prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a rendition element in VICAV rendition library.

spanGrp.span: Nimrod, the son on Kanaan, isn’t it like that Ibrahim? Nimrod, the son of Kanaan.
Didn’t he look into… In the past, they had soothsayers who used sand. (One of them) opened the book, looked it up and saw a child appearing who will destroy his (lit. your) religion.
They said to Nimrod, “That’s what it is.” Therefore, he prevented the women to become pregnant, killed those children who had been born, and slashed the bellies of women who had become pregnant.
As for Umus, Umus the father of Abraham, the friend of God, his wife had remained like this. It was not visible, it was not clear that she was pregnant.

When the time of delivery had come, she left the town, went to a cave and there gave birth to a boy. Then she left him. After two or three hours she returned to see whether he was dead or still alive; he was just a newborn boy!

When she came, lo and behold, there was a gazelle above him who suckled him from her udder. How do you say to šigg? This is a šigg. – This? – A dug. The Arabs in Syria call it dēd, but we call it šigg.
The gazelle suckled him. When she came inside: oh, Goodness! It was just crushing him with its belly and he was going to die.
She carried the newborn child to another cave. A newborn child who was Abraham, the friend of God, peace be upon him!
She carried him up to another cave so that the gazelle does not go there. It could not reach the place.
After one day she came again and, lo and behold, he was walking. After one day he was able to walk. – Did the gazelle suckle him every day? – Yes!
When he had reached the age of fourteen or fifteen, he sat down on Nimrod’s lap. His father whom they called Azara,

was an engineer. – An engineer. – His father was an engineer who made idols. You know what an idol is? – Yes, I know. – Statues of idols. – aṣnām. – Idols. The Lord of the Worlds, He is praised and sublime said that they should go up to a certain place.
All people went there. He (Azaza) said, “Who will guard the church?” They said, “We leave this one here to watch it and we will go.”
He said, “Allright, you go!” Then he (Abraham) destroyed them all. He destroyed them with an axe. And he put the largest and most strange idol on his neck.
When they came back they said, “Who is the one who did this act?” They said, “There is nobody but Abraham who can do this.” They called him and he said, “Is it you who did that?”

He said, “Just ask him (viz. the idol)! If I was it who did it, he may know it.” He said, “This one does not talk.” Then he said, “Since he doesn’t seem to speak, why do you worship him? Why all the worship?”
He, (Nimrod) the cursed one, let erect a catapult. He made a catapult and he had firewood gathered from here to Raqqa. The Syrian Raqqa.
He collected it all here and lit the fire. Then he put him (Abraham) on the catapult because nobody could come near the fire, it was sizzling hot.
He seized the arm of the catapult and so the catapult did not sling him away. This is what the book Daqāyiq al-axbār says. Weren’t they all on the top of the castle?

It is said that they saw a person coming from the village of Yenice. From there he appeared. – From Yenice. – Yes. And he was wearing a red coat, a coat. Yes, a red jacket, trousers, and a hat. A colourful hat with a brim, with a red brim.
When he came he looked around. He was coming strait to them. Haven’t all the people come together on top of the castle?
He said, “What’s wrong with you?” They said, “This catapult does not sling Abraham away (into the fire).” He said, “I will tell you the story now. I am never sincere but this time I will be honest.
It was the devil, may God’s curse be on him! He said, “Bring a female and a male person and let them perform shameful deeds. Then it will sling by itself.”
When they had brought the male and the female, from those gypsies, they made sex there.

He said, “O Lord of the Worlds, He is praised and sublime!” It is said that even the demons of the earth, however many demons there are they said:, “Abraham, just tell us and we will now destroy the world and rebuild it.” The angels (said the same).

He said, “I don’t want any help from anybody.” When the catapult threw him away, when it threw him away, at that moment the basmala came down on him: In the name of God the compassionate and merciful. He (God) said,
“O fire, become cold and safe for Abraham!” The fire cooled down and Gabriel brought him into the middle of the room.
Just when he descended from the fire the mosquitoes appeared. Let’s make the story short now. – Yes!
The soldiers could not see their hands in front of their eyes. People killed people. One from them came but they had fled. The people fled.
Nimrod said, “Why did you flee?” He said, “Because he has soldiers whom we cannot defeat and fight.”
He said, “What kind of soldiers?” He said, “Like this, small and with wings, by God.” “What’s that all about? You cannot fight them?” – They are mosquitoes. – Yes.
He said, “Yes.” – “ How is it??” He said, “I don’t know but they are so small and like this.”
He looked around and saw one on an idol. He said, “Ah, this is one.” He said, “Yes, this is one.”
He said, “This one?” He said, “Yes!” and it entered his nose. The Lord of the Worlds said, “Grow!” And so it ate his brain and this is the way (Nimrod) died.
